Katya is taken aback by the answer. Of course, she couldn't expect him 
to know everything, but she did expect something else.

Katya: Drawing first blood? Of course, it is an approach that 
minimizes losses, but where is the fun in that? We might as well start 
using dishonorable artillery right away.

She enters the base before going on.

Katya: The bidding ritual is done in two parts. Before a battle, we 
issue a batchall -a battle challenge- and ask what forces the defender 
will use. After that, two commanders bid against each other to bring 
to least troops possible to achieve victory.

--- In nbwrpg@y..., Kyle Stewart <dewboy30816@y...> wrote:
> Owlhawk:  Each side agrees to send in a pre set either
> number or percent of warriors and they hold a battle
> to the first damage rather than death to determine who
> goes and who stays.
> 
> He hoped his complete guess lucked out.
> 
> --- warriorazure <wingedwarrior41@h...> wrote:
> > Katya was pleased. He seemed to catch things up
> > pretty fast, which 
> > usually wasn't the case with even Inner Sphere
> > warriors they'd 
> > captured.
> > 
> > Katya: Good! Let us continue then. The Clans have
> > developped another 
> > system that minimizes losses and promotes honor. It
> > is our bidding 
> > ritual. Without any clue, can you guess what it is,
> > quineg?
> > 
> > 
>
